title: Real-time text streaming
body:
I'd like to use simplemind for text streaming use cases. It's a nice UX feature where the user can start seeing/reading responses while it's generated, instead of waiting for its completion. 

I'm preparing a suggestion PR by implementing it for OpenAI. If you like it, I can implement it for other providers as well.
author: barisozmen

comments.body: @barisozmen wanna help get the others ones integrated?
I saw your message late. I see you already done it :)

title: Too many forced dependencies
body: If someone wants to try simplemind with just the OpenAI client, they are still forced to install all other clients like Groq and Anthropic. Is it possible to make all the client installs optional so that users are not forced to install anything they do not use?
author: Siddhesh-Agarwal

comments.body: Ideally, all the import statements can be shifted inside the `client()` method so that the libraries are not forced dependencies.
Great idea. I still want them installed by default, but youâ€™re right we should move the imports to runtime

title: minimum python support version
body: A minimum Python version of 3.11 is a very high bar given that 3.9 still hasn't reached EOL. In my opinion, a minimum version of 3.10 would be more apt given that it introduced a cleaner syntax for type hinting (which we can't use in 3.9)
author: Siddhesh-Agarwal

comments.body: 3.10 sounds like a good target to me, too.
I have gone through the minimum python support version for all libraries and 3.9 seems to be the highest base version required. This means, we can go with python 3.10
okay sounds good! want to send a pr? :)
